page.title: 03LANDSCAPE TO THE WEST
page.content: To the west{Open Farmland.}The land- scape in this part is dominated by the A9 road,the railway line,the River Allan and farmland. On the A9 many types of vehicle can be seen day or night.The railway line is the main Glasgow/Perth line and trains usually pass this stretch every half hour or so.The River is met by a tributary called the Knaik near the railway bridge and is fairly narrow & winding at this part. The river affords good fishing for sportsmen & herons alike! The farmland here is well defined with regularly fenced or hedged fields,all under cultivation. Farmhouses are larger and surrounded by storage sheds and other farm buildings.
